00034 /* Set HW related values */
00035 #ifdef CONFIG_CRAY_XT
00036 #include <aries/aries_timeouts_gpl.h>
00037 #else
00038 /* from aries_timeouts_gpl.h when building for generic kernel */
00039 #define TIMEOUT_SECS(x)         ((uint64_t)(((x) / 1000.0) + 0.5))
00040 #ifndef TO_GNILND_timeout
00041 #define TO_GNILND_timeout               (60000.000000)
00042 #endif /* TO_GNILND_timeout */
00043 #endif /* CONFIG_CRAY_XT */
00044 
00045 #define GNILND_BASE_TIMEOUT        TIMEOUT_SECS(TO_GNILND_timeout)
00046 #define GNILND_CHECKSUM_DEFAULT    0            /* all off for Aries */
00047 
00048 #if defined(CONFIG_CRAY_COMPUTE)
00049 #define GNILND_REVERSE_RDMA        GNILND_REVERSE_PUT
00050 #define GNILND_RDMA_DLVR_OPTION    GNI_DLVMODE_PERFORMANCE
00051 #else
00052 #define GNILND_REVERSE_RDMA        GNILND_REVERSE_GET
00053 #define GNILND_RDMA_DLVR_OPTION    GNI_DLVMODE_PERFORMANCE
00054 #define GNILND_SCHED_THREADS       7             /* scheduler threads */
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 /* Thread-safe kgni implemented in minor ver 45, code rev 0xb9 */
00058 #define GNILND_KGNI_TS_MINOR_VER 0x45
00059 #define GNILND_TS_ENABLE         1
00060 
00061 /* register some memory to allocate a shared mdd */
00062 static inline gni_return_t
00063 kgnilnd_register_smdd_buf(kgn_device_t *dev)
00064 {
00065         __u32        flags = GNI_MEM_READWRITE;
00066 
00067         if (*kgnilnd_tunables.kgn_bte_relaxed_ordering) {
00068                 flags |= GNI_MEM_RELAXED_PI_ORDERING;
00069         }
00070 
00071         LIBCFS_ALLOC(dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf, PAGE_SIZE);
00072         if (!dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf) {
00073                 CERROR("Can't allocate smdd hold buffer\n");
00074                 return GNI_RC_ERROR_RESOURCE;
00075         }
00076 
00077         return kgnilnd_mem_register(dev->gnd_handle,
00078                                     (__u64)dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf,
00079                                     PAGE_SIZE, NULL, flags,
00080                                     &dev->gnd_smdd_hold_hndl);
00081 }
00082 
00083 static inline gni_return_t
00084 kgnilnd_deregister_smdd_buf(kgn_device_t *dev)
00085 {
00086         gni_return_t rc = kgnilnd_mem_deregister(dev->gnd_handle,
00087                                                  &dev->gnd_smdd_hold_hndl, 0);
00088         LIBCFS_FREE(dev->gnd_smdd_hold_buf, PAGE_SIZE);
00089 
00090         return rc;
00091 }
00092 
00093 /* plug in our functions for use on the simulator */
00094 #if !defined(GNILND_USE_RCA)
00095 
00096 extern kgn_data_t kgnilnd_data;
00097 
00098 #define kgnilnd_hw_hb()              do {} while(0)
00099 
00100 #ifdef CONFIG_CRAY_XT
00101 
00102 /* Aries Sim doesn't have hardcoded tables, so we'll hijack the nic_pe
00103  * and decode our address and nic addr from that - the rest are just offsets */
00104 
00105 static inline int
00106 kgnilnd_nid_to_nicaddrs(__u32 nid, int numnic, __u32 *nicaddr)
00107 {
00108         if (numnic > 1) {
00109                 CERROR("manual nid2nic translation doesn't support"
00110                        "multiple nic addrs (you asked for %d)\n",
00111                         numnic);
00112                 return -EINVAL;
00113         }
00114         if (nid < kgnilnd_data.kgn_nid_trans_private) {
00115                 CERROR("Request for invalid nid translation %u,"
00116                        "minimum "LPU64"\n",
00117                        nid, kgnilnd_data.kgn_nid_trans_private);
00118                 return -ESRCH;
00119         }
00120 
00121         *nicaddr = nid - kgnilnd_data.kgn_nid_trans_private;
00122 
00123         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "Sim nid %d -> nic 0x%x\n", nid, *nicaddr);
00124 
00125         return 1;
00126 }
00127 
00128 static inline int
00129 kgnilnd_nicaddr_to_nid(__u32 nicaddr, __u32 *nid)
00130 {
00131         *nid = kgnilnd_data.kgn_nid_trans_private + nicaddr;
00132         return 1;
00133 }
00134 
00135 /* XXX Nic: This does not support multiple device!!!! */
00136 static inline int
00137 kgnilnd_setup_nic_translation(__u32 device_id)
00138 {
00139         char              *if_name = "ipogif0";
00140         __u32              ipaddr, netmask, my_nid;
00141         int                up, rc;
00142 
00143         LCONSOLE_INFO("using Aries SIM IP info for RCA translation\n");
00144 
00145         rc = lnet_ipif_query(if_name, &up, &ipaddr, &netmask);
00146         if (rc != 0) {
00147                 CERROR ("can't get IP interface for %s: %d\n", if_name, rc);
00148                 return rc;
00149         }
00150         if (!up) {
00151                 CERROR ("IP interface %s is down\n", if_name);
00152                 return -ENODEV;
00153         }
00154 
00155         my_nid = ((ipaddr >> 8) & 0xFF) + (ipaddr & 0xFF);
00156         kgnilnd_data.kgn_nid_trans_private = my_nid - device_id;
00157 
00158         return 0;
00159 }
00160 
00161 #else /* CONFIG_CRAY_XT */
00162 #include <net/inet_common.h>
00163 #include <linux/if_arp.h>
00164 
00165 static inline int
00166 kgnilnd_nid_to_nicaddrs(__u32 nid, int numnic, __u32 *nicaddrs)
00167 {
00168         int rc;
00169 
00170 #define NID_MASK ((1ULL << 18) - 1)
00171         mm_segment_t fs;
00172         struct arpreq req = {
00173                 .arp_dev = "ipogif0",
00174         };
00175 
00176         req.arp_pa.sa_family = AF_INET;
00177         ((struct sockaddr_in *)&req.arp_pa)->sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(nid);
00178 
00179         fs = get_fs();
00180         set_fs(get_ds());
00181 
00182         rc = inet_ioctl(kgnilnd_data.kgn_sock, SIOCGARP, (unsigned long)&req);
00183         set_fs(fs);
00184 
00185         if (rc < 0) {
00186                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "inet_ioctl returned %d\n", rc);
00187                 return 0;
00188         }
00189 
00190         /* use the lower 18 bits of the mac address to use as a nid value */
00191         *nicaddrs = *(__u32 *)&req.arp_ha.sa_data[2];
00192         *nicaddrs = ntohl(*nicaddrs) & NID_MASK;
00193 
00194         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "nid %s -> nic 0x%x\n", libcfs_nid2str(nid),
00195                 nicaddrs[0]);
00196 
00197         return 1;
00198 }
00199 
00200 static inline int
00201 kgnilnd_nicaddr_to_nid(__u32 nicaddr, __u32 *nid)
00202 {
00203         int rc;
00204         mm_segment_t fs;
00205         struct ifreq ifr = {
00206                 .ifr_name = "ipogif0",
00207         };
00208 
00209         struct sockaddr_in* ipaddr = (struct sockaddr_in*)&ifr.ifr_addr;
00210 
00211         fs = get_fs();
00212         set_fs(get_ds());
00213         rc = inet_ioctl(kgnilnd_data.kgn_sock, SIOCGIFADDR, (unsigned long)&ifr);
00214         set_fs(fs);
00215 
00216         if (rc < 0) {
00217                 CDEBUG(D_NETERROR, "inet_ioctl returned %d\n", rc);
00218                 return 1;
00219         }
00220 
00221         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "ipaddr %08x\n", htonl(ipaddr->sin_addr.s_addr));
00222 
00223         *nid = htonl(ipaddr->sin_addr.s_addr);
00224         CDEBUG(D_NETTRACE, "nic 0x%x -> nid %s\n", nicaddr,
00225                 libcfs_nid2str(*nid));
00226         return 0;
00227 }
00228 
00229 static inline int
00230 kgnilnd_setup_nic_translation(__u32 device_id)
00231 {
00232         return 0;
00233 }
00234 
00235 #endif /* CONFIG_CRAY_XT */
00236 
00237 #endif /* GNILND_USE_RCA */

00239 #endif /* _GNILND_ARIES_H */
